H0.text: Reflection was the discovery necessary before radio could be invented.

H1.text: Radiation was the discovery necessary before radio could be invented.

H2.text: Electricity was the discovery necessary before radio could be invented.

H3.text: Gravity was the discovery necessary before the invention of radio.

A4.text: James Clerk Maxwell proposed theories of electromagnetism and mathematical proofs demonstrating that light, radio and x-rays were all types of electromagnetic waves propagating through free space.

A5.text: Between 1886 and 1888, Heinrich Rudolf Hertz published the results of experiments wherein he was able to transmit electromagnetic waves (radio waves) through the air, proving Maxwell's electromagnetic theory.
